question1.en: If you could have any animal as a pet, what would it be?
question1.ja: もしどんな動物でもペットにできるとしたら、何がいい？

answer1_variations.en: I'd love to have a sloth.
answer1_variations.ja: ナマケモノを飼ってみたいな。

answer1_variations.en: I've always wanted a hedgehog.
answer1_variations.ja: ずっとハリネズミが欲しかったんだ。

answer1_detail.en: They seem so chill and low-maintenance.
answer1_detail.ja: 彼らはすごくのんびりしていて、手がかからなそうだから。

question2.en: Wouldn't it be hard to take care of?
question2.ja: 世話をするのは大変じゃない？

answer2_variations.en: Maybe, but watching them would be relaxing.
answer2_variations.ja: かもね、でも見ているだけで癒やされそうだよ。

answer2_variations.en: I'd need to do some research first.
answer2_variations.ja: まずはちゃんと調べないといけないね。

vocab.meaning: 手がかからない、世話が楽な
のんびりした、落ち着いた

question1.en: Can I pet your dog?
question1.ja: そのワンちゃん、撫でてもいいですか？

answer1_variations.en: Sure, he loves people!
answer1_variations.ja: もちろんです、彼は人が大好きなんですよ！

answer1_variations.en: Sorry, he's a bit shy with strangers.
answer1_variations.ja: ごめんなさい、彼は知らない人がちょっと苦手なんです。

answer1_detail.en: He doesn't bite, so don't worry.
answer1_detail.ja: 噛んだりしないので、心配しないでくださいね。

question2.en: What breed is he?
question2.ja: 犬種は何ですか？

answer2_variations.en: He's a mix of a Poodle and a Labrador.
answer2_variations.ja: プードルとラブラドールのミックスです。

answer2_variations.en: He's actually a rescue dog, so I'm not sure.
answer2_variations.ja: 実は保護犬なので、よく分からないんです。

question1.en: Have you ever been to a cat cafe?
question1.ja: 猫カフェに行ったことある？

answer1_variations.en: Yeah, I went to one in Tokyo last year.
answer1_variations.ja: うん、去年東京で行ったよ。

answer1_variations.en: No, I'm actually allergic to cats.
answer1_variations.ja: ううん、実は猫アレルギーなんだ。

answer1_detail.en: It was incredibly relaxing to be around them.
answer1_detail.ja: 猫たちに囲まれて、すごく癒やされたよ。

question2.en: Did you have a favorite one?
question2.ja: お気に入りの子はいた？

answer2_variations.en: There was a fluffy white one that slept on my lap.
answer2_variations.ja: 膝の上で寝てくれた、白くてふわふわな子がいたよ。

answer2_variations.en: They were all too cute to pick just one.
answer2_variations.ja: みんな可愛すぎて、一匹だけなんて選べないよ。

vocab.meaning: 信じられないほど、すごく

question1.en: Are there any animals you are afraid of?
question1.ja: 何か苦手な動物っている？

answer1_variations.en: I absolutely can't stand spiders.
answer1_variations.ja: クモがどうしても無理なんだ。

answer1_variations.en: Snakes kind of creep me out.
answer1_variations.ja: ヘビはちょっと気味が悪くて苦手かな。

answer1_detail.en: I just can't handle all those legs.
answer1_detail.ja: あのたくさんの脚がどうしてもダメなんだよ。

question2.en: What do you do if you find one in your room?
question2.ja: もし部屋で見つけたらどうするの？

answer2_variations.en: I scream and call for help immediately.
answer2_variations.ja: 叫んで即座に助けを呼ぶよ。

answer2_variations.en: I try to catch it and release it outside.
answer2_variations.ja: 捕まえて外に逃がしてあげるようにしてる。

vocab.meaning: ～をぞっとさせる、気味悪がらせる

question1.en: Do you like watching animal documentaries?
question1.ja: 動物のドキュメンタリー番組は好き？

answer1_variations.en: I love them! Especially the ones about sea life.
answer1_variations.ja: 大好き！特に海の生き物のやつがね。

answer1_variations.en: Sometimes, but I don't like the brutal scenes.
answer1_variations.ja: たまにね。でも残酷なシーンは苦手だな。

answer1_detail.en: I was amazed at how smart killer whales are.
answer1_detail.ja: シャチがいかに賢いかを知って驚いたよ。

question2.en: Did you learn any fun facts?
question2.ja: 何か面白い事実はあった？

answer2_variations.en: Apparently, they have different dialects.
answer2_variations.ja: どうやら、彼らには異なる方言があるらしいよ。

answer2_variations.en: They actually hunt in teams.
answer2_variations.ja: 彼らはチームを組んで狩りをするんだって。

question1.en: Have you seen any wild animals around here?
question1.ja: この辺りで野生動物を見かけたことある？

answer1_variations.en: I saw a wild boar near the mountains.
answer1_variations.ja: 山の近くでイノシシを見たよ。

answer1_variations.en: Just the usual stray cats and crows.
answer1_variations.ja: いつもの野良猫とカラスくらいかな。

answer1_detail.en: It came out of the bushes suddenly and surprised me.
answer1_detail.ja: 茂みから突然出てきて、びっくりしたよ。

question2.en: Did it chase you?
question2.ja: 追いかけられたりした？

answer2_variations.en: No, it ran away as soon as it saw me.
answer2_variations.ja: ううん、僕を見るなり逃げていったよ。

answer2_variations.en: Thankfully no, but I froze for a second.
answer2_variations.ja: 幸いなかったけど、一瞬固まっちゃったよ。

question1.en: I'm thinking about getting a parrot.
question1.ja: オウムを飼おうかと思っているんだ。

answer1_variations.en: That sounds fun! They are very intelligent.
answer1_variations.ja: それは楽しそうだね！彼らはとても賢いよ。

answer1_variations.en: Be careful, they can be pretty noisy.
answer1_variations.ja: 気をつけた方がいいよ、結構うるさいからね。

answer1_detail.en: Some of them can live for over 50 years.
answer1_detail.ja: 種類によっては50年以上生きるのもいるんだよ。

question2.en: Really? That's a huge commitment.
question2.ja: 本当？それはすごい責任重大だね。

answer2_variations.en: Yeah, it's basically a lifelong friendship.
answer2_variations.ja: うん、基本的には一生の付き合いになるね。

answer2_variations.en: You definitely need to be prepared for that.
answer2_variations.ja: 間違いなくその覚悟が必要だよ。

question1.en: Do you prefer zoos or aquariums?
question1.ja: 動物園と水族館、どっちが好き？

answer1_variations.en: Definitely aquariums. I love jellyfish.
answer1_variations.ja: 断然、水族館だね。クラゲが大好きなんだ。

answer1_variations.en: I like zoos because I want to see lions.
answer1_variations.ja: ライオンが見たいから動物園かな。

answer1_detail.en: Watching the fish swim is so mesmerizing.
answer1_detail.ja: 魚が泳いでいるのを見ると、うっとりしちゃうんだ。

question2.en: Do you have a favorite sea creature?
question2.ja: 好きな海の生き物はいる？

answer2_variations.en: I've always liked sea turtles.
answer2_variations.ja: 昔からウミガメが好きなんだ。

answer2_variations.en: Otters are my favorite. They're adorable.
answer2_variations.ja: カワウソが一番かな。愛らしいよ。

vocab.meaning: 魅惑的な、うっとりさせる

question1.en: Have you ever ridden a horse?
question1.ja: 馬に乗ったことはある？

answer1_variations.en: Yes, I tried it once during a trip.
answer1_variations.ja: うん、旅行中に一度試したよ。

answer1_variations.en: No, but it's on my bucket list.
answer1_variations.ja: ううん、でもいつかやってみたいことの一つだよ。

answer1_detail.en: It was much higher and shakier than I expected.
answer1_detail.ja: 思っていたよりずっと高くて揺れたよ。

question2.en: Was it scary?
question2.ja: 怖かった？

answer2_variations.en: A little bit, but the horse was gentle.
answer2_variations.ja: ちょっとね、でもその馬は優しかったよ。

answer2_variations.en: Not really, I felt like a cowboy!
answer2_variations.ja: そんなことないよ、カウボーイになった気分だった！

vocab.meaning: 死ぬまでにやりたいことリスト

question1.en: What do you think about animal cafes?
question1.ja: 動物カフェについてどう思う？

answer1_variations.en: They're cute, but I worry about the animals' stress.
answer1_variations.ja: 可愛いけど、動物たちのストレスが心配だな。

answer1_variations.en: It's a great way to interact with exotic animals.
answer1_variations.ja: 珍しい動物と触れ合える良い方法だと思うよ。

answer1_detail.en: Imagine being touched by strangers all day.
answer1_detail.ja: 一日中知らない人に触られることを想像してみてよ。

question2.en: That's a good point.
question2.ja: 確かにそれは一理あるね。

answer2_variations.en: Yeah, strict rules are necessary for their well-being.
answer2_variations.ja: うん、彼らの幸福のためには厳しいルールが必要だよ。

answer2_variations.en: I hope they get plenty of rest breaks.
answer2_variations.ja: ちゃんと休憩時間がたくさんあるといいんだけど。

question1.en: If you were an animal, which one would you be?
question1.ja: もし自分が動物だとしたら、何になると思う？

answer1_variations.en: I think I'd be an owl.
answer1_variations.ja: フクロウかな。

answer1_variations.en: Definitely a dolphin.
answer1_variations.ja: 間違いなくイルカだね。

answer1_detail.en: People tell me I'm observant and like the night.
answer1_detail.ja: 観察眼が鋭いとか、夜型だって言われるから。

question2.en: That fits your personality perfectly.
question2.ja: 君の性格にぴったりだね。

answer2_variations.en: Right? I like staying up late.
answer2_variations.ja: でしょ？夜更かしが好きだしね。

answer2_variations.en: I just like the idea of flying silently.
answer2_variations.ja: ただ静かに飛ぶっていうのがいいなと思って。

vocab.meaning: 観察眼が鋭い、目ざとい

question1.en: Are you okay with bugs?
question1.ja: 虫は平気？

answer1_variations.en: Not at all, they gross me out.
answer1_variations.ja: 全然ダメ、気持ち悪いよ。

answer1_variations.en: I don't mind them, except for mosquitoes.
answer1_variations.ja: 蚊以外なら気にならないよ。

answer1_detail.en: Even butterflies make me nervous.
answer1_detail.ja: 蝶々でさえ、見てると不安になるんだ。

question2.en: What about beetles? Kids love them.
question2.ja: カブトムシはどう？子供は大好きだけど。

answer2_variations.en: They look like armored tanks, which is cool.
answer2_variations.ja: 装甲戦車みたいでかっこいいとは思うよ。

answer2_variations.en: Still a no for me. Too many legs.
answer2_variations.ja: それでも無理だな。脚が多すぎるよ。

vocab.meaning: ～を気持ち悪がらせる、ゾッとさせる

question1.en: Did you know that pandas are endangered?
question1.ja: パンダが絶滅危惧種だって知ってた？

answer1_variations.en: Yes, it's really sad to hear.
answer1_variations.ja: うん、本当に悲しい話だよね。

answer1_variations.en: Actually, their numbers are slightly increasing.
answer1_variations.ja: 実は、数はわずかに増えているらしいよ。

answer1_detail.en: Loss of habitat is the biggest problem.
answer1_detail.ja: 生息地の減少が最大の問題なんだ。

question2.en: Is there anything we can do to help?
question2.ja: 私たちが助けになれることはあるかな？

answer2_variations.en: Supporting conservation groups is a start.
answer2_variations.ja: 保護団体を支援することが第一歩だね。

answer2_variations.en: Raising awareness is important too.
answer2_variations.ja: 認知を広めることも重要だよ。

question1.en: Did you have any pets growing up?
question1.ja: 子供の頃、何かペットは飼ってた？

answer1_variations.en: We had a hamster named Hammy.
answer1_variations.ja: ハミーっていうハムスターを飼ってたよ。

answer1_variations.en: My apartment didn't allow pets, unfortunately.
answer1_variations.ja: 残念ながら、うちのアパートはペット禁止だったんだ。

answer1_detail.en: He was tiny but had a big personality.
answer1_detail.ja: 彼は小さかったけど、個性豊かだったよ。

question2.en: Hamsters are great first pets.
question2.ja: ハムスターは初めてのペットに最適だよね。

answer2_variations.en: Yeah, they teach you responsibility.
answer2_variations.ja: うん、責任感を教えてくれるしね。

answer2_variations.en: But their lifespan is so short.
answer2_variations.ja: でも寿命がすごく短いんだよね。

question1.en: Have you ever seen a sheep shearing show?
question1.ja: 羊の毛刈りショーって見たことある？

answer1_variations.en: Yes, at a farm in Hokkaido.
answer1_variations.ja: うん、北海道の牧場で見たよ。

answer1_variations.en: No, but I've seen videos of it.
answer1_variations.ja: ううん、でも動画では見たことある。

answer1_detail.en: The sheep looked so much smaller afterwards!
answer1_detail.ja: 終わった後の羊、すごく小さく見えたよ！

question2.en: Do they get cold without their wool?
question2.ja: 羊毛がないと寒くないのかな？

answer2_variations.en: They usually do it in spring, so it's fine.
answer2_variations.ja: たいてい春にやるから大丈夫だよ。

answer2_variations.en: I think they feel relieved to be lighter.
answer2_variations.ja: 軽くなってほっとしてると思うよ。

question1.en: The cicadas are really loud this year.
question1.ja: 今年はセミの声が本当にうるさいね。

answer1_variations.en: Yeah, it's almost deafening.
answer1_variations.ja: うん、耳がおかしくなりそうなくらいだよ。

answer1_variations.en: It doesn't feel like summer without them.
answer1_variations.ja: 彼らがいないと夏って感じがしないけどね。

answer1_detail.en: Their sound is surprisingly nostalgic for me.
answer1_detail.ja: その音は私にとって意外と懐かしいものなんだ。

question2.en: Did you use to catch them as a kid?
question2.ja: 子供の頃、捕まえたりした？

answer2_variations.en: All the time! I had a net and a cage.
answer2_variations.ja: いつもやってたよ！網とカゴを持ってね。

answer2_variations.en: No, I was too afraid to touch them.
answer2_variations.ja: ううん、怖くて触れなかったよ。

vocab.meaning: 耳をつんざくような、とてもうるさい

question1.en: How do you feel about snakes?
question1.ja: ヘビってどう思う？

answer1_variations.en: I'm actually fascinated by them.
answer1_variations.ja: 実はすごく惹かれるんだ。

answer1_variations.en: I'm terrified of them, honestly.
answer1_variations.ja: 正直、怖くてたまらないよ。

answer1_detail.en: Their skin patterns are beautiful if you look closely.
answer1_detail.ja: 近くで見ると、皮膚の模様が綺麗なんだよ。

question2.en: Would you ever hold one?
question2.ja: 持ってみたりできる？

answer2_variations.en: If it's not poisonous, sure.
answer2_variations.ja: 毒がないなら、もちろん。

answer2_variations.en: No way, not even for a million dollars.
answer2_variations.ja: 絶対に無理、100万ドルもらっても嫌だね。

vocab.meaning: 恐れおののいている、とても怖い

question1.en: Look at those birds flying in formation.
question1.ja: 見て、あの鳥たちが編隊を組んで飛んでる。

answer1_variations.en: Wow, that's impressive.
answer1_variations.ja: わあ、それは見事だね。

answer1_variations.en: It must be migration season.
answer1_variations.ja: 渡りの季節に違いないね。

answer1_detail.en: Geese travel thousands of miles like that.
answer1_detail.ja: ガチョウはああやって何千マイルも旅をするんだ。

question2.en: How do they know where to go?
question2.ja: どうやって行き先が分かるんだろう？

answer2_variations.en: Some say they use the earth's magnetic field.
answer2_variations.ja: 地磁気を使っているっていう説があるよ。

answer2_variations.en: It's just pure instinct.
answer2_variations.ja: 純粋な本能だろうね。

question1.en: Do you know what a capybara is?
question1.ja: カピバラって何か知ってる？

answer1_variations.en: The giant hamster looking thing?
answer1_variations.ja: あの巨大なハムスターみたいなやつ？

answer1_variations.en: Yes! They love hot springs.
answer1_variations.ja: うん！彼らは温泉が大好きなんだよね。

answer1_detail.en: They are actually the world's largest rodent.
answer1_detail.ja: 実は世界最大のげっ歯類（ネズミの仲間）なんだよ。

question2.en: Are they friendly?
question2.ja: 人懐っこいの？

answer2_variations.en: Very. Other animals love hanging out with them.
answer2_variations.ja: すごくね。他の動物も彼らと一緒にいるのが好きみたい。

answer2_variations.en: They seem pretty chill and harmless.
answer2_variations.ja: かなり穏やかで無害に見えるよ。

vocab.meaning: げっ歯動物（ネズミ、リスなど）
（誰かと）一緒に過ごす、たむろする

question1.en: My cat keeps scratching the furniture.
question1.ja: うちの猫が家具をひっかいてばかりいるんだ。

answer1_variations.en: You should get a scratching post.
answer1_variations.ja: 爪とぎを用意したほうがいいよ。

answer1_variations.en: Maybe he's bored or stressed.
answer1_variations.ja: たぶん退屈か、ストレスが溜まってるのかも。

answer1_detail.en: Cats need to sharpen their claws naturally.
answer1_detail.ja: 猫はどうしても爪を研ぐ必要がある習性だからね。

question2.en: Does a scratching post actually help?
question2.ja: 爪とぎって本当に効果あるの？

answer2_variations.en: It usually saves your sofa.
answer2_variations.ja: たいていはそれでソファが助かるよ。

answer2_variations.en: You can also try trimming their nails.
answer2_variations.ja: 爪を切ってあげるのも手だよ。
